results.title: The Big island
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The aim of this film is to show an international audience within a limited time span some attractive aspects of Australian life. Representing Australia as a brisk and exciting place and creating a mood of a young country on the move. Cinematography by Keith Gow, and Don McAlpine. Music by George Dreyfus. (Awards: AFI Travel Award 1970)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.description: The aim of this film is to show an international audience within a limited time span some attractive aspects of Australian life. (Awards: AFI Travel Award 1970)

results.title: Australian diary. No. 003
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: a look at a Brisbane creche; Spanish monks and nuns teach Aboriginal children at New Norcia, a mission in Western Australia; families shown mining mica at Harts Range in the Northern terrotory and a Victorian fashion parade as models exhibit the latest styles in woollen clothing.

results.title: RAAF heritage
results.creator_credit: Stanley Dalby, Roland Beckett and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The history of the Royal Australian Air Force and the original Australian Flying Corps, showing action in World Wars I and II, Korea, Malaya and Vietnam.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 072
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: plywood veneer cut from giant trees is shown being made in a factory near Cairns using local timber; Ravenswood, ghost town with glamour near Townsville, was once a busy mining town but now has a very small population including the young woman who runs the local store and many other services; Manus Island, part of Papua New Guinea is a very important Pacific base for the RAAF.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.title: The Great War
results.creator_credit: Alan Anderson, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “War Experience”.
Uses contemporary film records of the Australian forces in the 1914-18 War to illustrate the conditions in which they served and the effects on survivors.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alan Anderson, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Australian diary. No. 034
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The items featured in this cinemagazine show the harvesting of apples in Tasmania; the manufacture of costume jewellery; the expoert of South Australian crayfish by air to the United States which is earning valuable export dollars; the work of Matron Shaw at the Crown-Street Women’s Hospital; and the parks and gardens of Canberra.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 005
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This cinemagazine features the following items: swimming instruction classes in New South Wales; problems with traffic in Melbourne; First Nations people show their skill with the stockwhip; Sulman architectural awards and strange animals at the Melbourne Zoo.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 026
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: a play centre/nursery school opens in Canberra; Norris E. Dodd, United Nations Director of Food, outlines the world food position; overseas telecommunications are featured and a closer look at Broken Hill is shown.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 071
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: ant hills in the north of the continent are a natural mystery; aa flying padre ministers to a congregation spread over a vast area; Fulbright scholars extend their knowledge of Australia and the art of making a humble broom is shown.

results.title: The Helping hand
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Visatone (Australia)
results.brief_description: Three new-Australians tell of the moment when they felt accepted in Australia and how they have worked to fit in with the local way of living. English lessons at Cooma are shown and finally a naturalization ceremony in a Sydney suburb.
